intro: Capsella integrifolia, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, with small, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruit is a slender, elongated silique that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Capsella integrifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
